website_summaries.verdict: This reasonably priced model may jam and the bobbin can be frustrating, but the machine is easy to use once you get past those hassles.
pros: Affordable machine with 23 popular stitches, including 11 for adding decorative touches to fabrics
Has straightforward knob controls and comes with useful accessories

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine works great
customer_reviews.text: Got it one day late ... But works just fine... I really like it... Found some good youtube videos to follow i can use it just fine and havent ran a sewing machine since jr high 1985...im 48... :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I have mastered threading the bobbin and the needle in one day.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Mother day gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Mother’s Day present for my mom, so far she loves it! She’s a beginner and as of now she has had no problems with it! She is overall very delighted with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Neida

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This machine came very well packed and it really does the job. Not a professional in the area but to learn is more than worth it. It also came with a video to learn how to insert the needle and the simple steps you need to know if you are not a professional. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Berenice’s

customer_reviews.title: This Singer is a household must.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and sturdy basic machine but with enough variations in the stitch patterns to make it a really useful househould must. Great and prompt service and delivery,well done.
customer_reviews.author: George Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Grandma Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this for my grandmother since she loves to knit. She loved it so I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Time to sew
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little sewing machine! Easy to use for those of us who don't see much!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Wargo

customer_reviews.title: Beginners friendly
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for beginners. Easy to operate and it has many features.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The sewing machine is easy to operate. It handles basic sewing with no problems
customer_reviews.author: P Rivers

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I want. Light weight and easy to move from room to room. I'm very pleased with the quality, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Machine jams repeatedly - a total disaster
customer_reviews.text: I used this machine ONLY to sew 100%ncotton COVID-19 masks - no heavy materials, no hard use. It has jammed 17 times in a month. I fix it, it stitches another mask or two, then jams again. I kept thinking It was “fixed” and let the return date go by. This machine is a disaster. Before I bought it, I used a borrowed Brother machine without any problems. I will never buy another Singer product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Bhardwaj

customer_reviews.title: Arrived promptly and in good shape!
customer_reviews.text: Love to sew, and love to keep it simple....believe this machine will do just that....Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leave your sewing to singer!
customer_reviews.text: It is everything I need to do basic repairs at such a great price! What more can I ask for!
customer_reviews.author: madonna  warters

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied, This seller is committed to resolve any issue with the order pastivly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while then all the sudden one day ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't do anything fancy, I hem my uniform pants. Worked great for a while then all the sudden one day I guess the timing got off? All I know is the needles continually snap and I've tried adjusting everything I can and they keep hitting the metal plate and breaking so this is now a paperweight. Was easier to just go back to hand sewing my pants, this machine just not worth the aggravation...complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: FrontLineTrainer

customer_reviews.title: My Wife Loves Singer 2263!
customer_reviews.text: This machine was just perfect for my wife who is just learning to sew. She has found helpful classes from Singer on their website and through Creativelive as well as UTube. She has practiced and has been busy making quilted tote bags for friends and relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: ... when she was using it she said it was fine, but once I started using the machine the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my Aunt's machine and when she was using it she said it was fine, but once I started using the machine the bobbin side of the thread tangles wayyyyy too easily and even jams up so much the needle breaks couple of times. I admit that I'm not the most experienced machine user, but the brother machine at my sewing class was far more easier to use and break proof. I am so frustrated and I'm going to ask my parents for a Brother machine for my birthday instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bea Jeon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Nice little machine. Lots of info on the internet if you have any issues. However, I guess am out of touch. I couldn't believe that they make sewing machines without a basting stitch. But, yes , they do, and this is one. Wish I had known that It should have been one of my criteria, being a novice sewer, Basting is much easier to correct.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it’s a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I rember my mom bought me this sewing machine fire Christmas and I was so happy. It was a beautiful color and looked cool. When I used it it was the opposite of it appearance. Bad and flimsy. The tension never worked and it skipped stitches. Please don’t waste your money guys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me making simple aprons and baby dolls pj.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Simple Singer it a little lady alway sew nicely, a couple time it did act up, but a good word or two, (like I'm going to throw u away) Some how oiling the machine and let it rest overnight, the machine is like new ❤️. I have 3 Singer that cost more than this one, but she my favorite as say Simple, Easy, Light Sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Starry2

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was given this machine as a gift and i love it. I did have some of the same problems others are talking about so i thought i would write a review. The issue of "bunching" fabric for me was a tension problem with the top thread. After playing around with it for about an hour i got it just about prefect. For cotton fabrics i would recomend putting your tension at 6 1/2 and length at 3. I havent had any problems with bunching fabric now. Iv noticed with alot of these reviews is its not always the machine but a simple tension or threading problem. Otherwise i really love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: This machine is nothing but a headache. I bought one and after hours of rethreading and pulling knots from the bobbin case I returned it for the same one hoping it was just a defective machine. The SECOND one has the same plus more issues!! I can't sew steady for 2 minutes without having to fix something. This machine is brand new out of the box!! Back to the store and I will not buy a 3rd. I'm going to try Brother, Singer is NOT THE SAME as it was known in the past. CHEAP CHEAP. DON'T waste your money or TIME!
customer_reviews.author: T. Weathers

customer_reviews.title: No singing on this singer 2263
customer_reviews.text: The word easy does not relate to this machine. I worked with it for about 4 hours and could not get it to work properly. My wife, who has much less patience than I worked with it for 30 without success. Back to the store it goes.
customer_reviews.author: scott stewart

customer_reviews.title: money in garbage, do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: simply, money in garbage, do not buy it, i did , piece of garbage
customer_reviews.author: Jerzy

customer_reviews.title: Singer website and suggestions are useless. overpriced
customer_reviews.text: if i could give it no stars i would. after my 3rd use it jammed up and is now inoperable. i have tried cleaning it out, taking the bobbin and the parts apart and back together again etc. Singer website and suggestions are useless. overpriced, a waste of $100 bucks. should have bought a used, metal older model
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on Singer sewing machines!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Today's Singer machines are NOT the gold standard as they once were! And this review probably extends to all Singer models. Mine (2263) was trash an hour into a sewing nightmare. Tensions wrong. Kept tangling threads and clogging. I couldn't even sew a straight seam.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Terrible machine
customer_reviews.text: I have spent more time fixing jams then actually sewing. My first (and only!) project on this machine was an apron, which should have taken half a day. I have been at it for 2 days now...because of repeated bobbin jams. So wish I hadn't bought this machine. I give it one star for being cheap.....but it's cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.author: S. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper at Walmart
customer_reviews.text: I have never sewn before, but I'm looking for a beginner level sewing machine so I can make homemade decor and party crafts. I think I have decided upon this one, and in case anyone is interested, this exact model is selling at Walmart for $77.97 (as of 7.26.13).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Frank

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this machine
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this machine, It was the first machine I ever used and it DOES function, but it has problems. Until I got a different machine I didn't realize how easy sewing actually is. With this machine, I always had tension issues, thread breaking, bobbing problems etc. Then I got a new machine and I can sew with no problems and am not stopping every 15 minutes to fix something.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa B

customer_reviews.title: It keeps jamming and breaking needles.
customer_reviews.text: Over the last two days I have broken three needles. It goes along getting more and more jagged sounding then jams up. I am an experienced sewing machine user. Been sewing since I was a little girl. The top thread catches on something inside and breaks as well. I am forever rethreading the needle. I am here on Amazon looking for a replacement and found this one for sale. When I do find another this one is going up for sale for $25 dollars or to give away if the buyer is making masks.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Pelton

customer_reviews.title: Great basic sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from Malwart years ago. I rarely need a sewing machine, but when I do it always works perfectly for me every time. It really got a workout sewing through several layers of fabric for masks after the COVID-19 pandemic started and it did great.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M.

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: don't waste your money, had machine less than 3 1/2 years, used it occasionally for mending. Engine seized up, couldn't do anything. Singer said they "might" pay for parts if I took it only to my authorized dealer, about 50 miles. Local repair said $30--$100 just to look at it. Junked this piece of junk & bought a Brother sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: horrible sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: horrible sewing machine! My mother in law is an avid sewer and we were getting our first machine, we found this machine to be noisy and did not wind the bobbins properly. we did not care for the bobbin case which is not the convenient top load found in newer models. also the thread tension was hard to manage since you had to adjust the top and bottom thread separately. overall we were not satisfied with the quality and purchased a Brother LX2763 model with a ton more features and included accessories and were far more satisfied for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Smith

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this machine, I sew mostly for mending and I am starting to try my hand at making my own clothes and this works well for that. It dose all the basic stiches you need to get started (I wish it had come with a zipper foot though) I have not run into problems when using it. Most people who have given it a lower rating seem to do so because of problems with the automatic needle threader (which in all fairness I have not used) but if you don't mind taking the few extra moments to thread the needle yourself it is really not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Shea

customer_reviews.title: Automatic threader is junk!
customer_reviews.text: The darn machine's "automatic threader" is junk. Went through two hours of watching the enclosed machine's instructional DVD, you tube videos, etc. and about 300 failed attempts before I realized that my brand new machine's auto needle threader contraption did not have the "hook" part that went through the eye of the needle. Really? Just out of the box and defective?? Taking it back to Wal-mart in a.m. and buying the cheaper but highly-rated Brother machine for $80 on Amazon. So disappointing. It looked like a great beginner sewing machine for an older novice, but so much for looks. Maybe the Brother's automatic threader will actually work!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Poor bobbin mechanism
customer_reviews.text: My first sewing machine, I've had more problems with thread jams on the front loading bobbin mechanism than I care to have. It makes sewing not fun. Also there are no markings on the thread allowance panel under the foot which I would want to use. The instructions are not complete - I have struggled with the bobbin so many times that I will be upgrading to a new machine very soon and I've only sewn a couple of pillows, mainly because it is so difficult to get more than one seam at a time without unloading the entire machine! The needle threader is really nice and that's why I gave it more than 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: somuchbetter

customer_reviews.title: I have really enjoyed my machine
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed my machine. My family liked these crafted gifts much more than many other items in the past. I also used you tube to figure out simple projects that would be fun and at my skill level.
customer_reviews.author: Artist

customer_reviews.title: I bought a separate bobbin winder because this one does such a terrible job. The tension is all over the place
customer_reviews.text: I am constantly struggling with this machine. I bought a separate bobbin winder because this one does such a terrible job. The tension is all over the place. Not worth the frustration
customer_reviews.author: dani

customer_reviews.title: Great machine but better in walmart for only $80
customer_reviews.text: So far this is an amazing machine. However this is a terrible price for a starter sewing machine so i did some research and i found one in walmart for $80 .I love it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Chabanov

customer_reviews.title: 3 days in and problems
customer_reviews.text: This machine was given as a gift and 3 days after receiving it we had problems. It's jammed and won't run. It is a big waste of a hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: ginski

product_meta.title: Singer Simple 2263 23-Stitch Sewing Machine White
feature_bullets: Easy Threading with automatic needle threader
Easy stitch selection with a turn of a dial
This sewing machine is warranted for use in the US and Canada at 110 volts only.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars117 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
